decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | The ground and first floor windows to be inserted in the north facing wall of the existing building shall be glazed with obscure (i.e. non see-through) glass and shall be fixed (i.e. non opening) except for any opening above eye level and retained as such for the lifeline of the building.  REASON:  In the interests of the privacy of neighbouring occupiers.
description: Erection of part single, and part two-storey extension to rear of dwellinghouse, and external alterations to existing north elevation wall to provide ground and first floor windows
